projectsCardData.title: Hybrid Solar & Gas Power
projectsCardData.description1: SEAP delivers 5MW hybrid mini-grids combining solar and gas to power rural economies.
projectsCardData.description2: The pilot phase in Kano, Imo, and Cross River sets the stage for a nationwide energy rollout.

projectsCardData.title: GIS & Satellite Mapping
projectsCardData.description1: Our GIS platform provides real-time data for planning and tracking impact across all 774 LGAs.
projectsCardData.description2: From site assessments to infrastructure monitoring, SEAP builds smarter, data-led energy systems.

projectsCardData.title: Clean Cooking Solutions
projectsCardData.description1: Replacing firewood and charcoal with biogas and LPCNG cylinders, SEAP is bringing clean, affordable cooking to over 20,000 households per LGA.
projectsCardData.description2: This initiative improves health, protects forests, and empowers women across Nigeria.

investBigCardData.title: E-Mobility
investBigCardData.description1: Invest in EV conversions, battery-swapping hubs, and charging stations across high-density transport zones.

investBigCardData.title: Industrial Infrastructure
investBigCardData.description1: Power-ready industrial parks and corridors mapped for manufacturing and trade-based investment.

investMidCardData.title: Utility-Scale Solar
investMidCardData.description: GIS-selected sites with strong irradiance and grid access for MW-scale solar development.

investSmallCardData.title: Agriculture & Agribusiness

news.title: Nigeria Joins Forces with WeLight to Power Rural Communities with $200M Mini-Grids
news.desc: A new PPP marks a major leap in delivering reliable, renewable energy to 1.5-2 million Nigerians.

news.title: AfDB Mobilizes $2.2B to Spark Nigeria's Agro-Processing Boom
news.desc: Huge investment to reduce food imports and bring processing capabilities closer to farmers in 28 states.

news.title: FG Commissions 30MW Power Project in Ogun to Kickstart Nationwide SEAP Rollout

news.title: China, Nigeria, and Others Reaffirm Global Cooperation on Climate Action
news.desc: China hosts global seminar on climate adaptation and energy transition with Nigeria and six nations pledging deeper cooperation on clean energy and capacity building

smallprjct.title: E-Mobility
smallprjct.desc1: SEAP's E-Mobility initiative is accelerating Nigeria's transition to clean, electric transportation by targeting high-use commercial vehicles like motorcycles (okadas), tricycles (kekes), and mini-buses. By deploying battery-swapping hubs and supporting EV conversions at scale, we are reducing emissions, lowering transport costs, and creating new green jobs.

smallprjct.title: Agriculture & Agribusiness
smallprjct.desc1: SEAP's integrated infrastructure model supports agricultural transformation by addressing energy, data, and value chain gaps across Nigeria's farming communities. From powering irrigation and processing to enabling storage and distribution, we're helping Nigeria unlock the full potential of its agri-economy—with technology, precision data, and clean energy at its core.

smallprjct.title: Mining
smallprjct.desc1: SEAP supports sustainable and energy-secure mining by enabling access to hybrid power, digital mapping tools, and sector-focused infrastructure in Nigeria's mineral-rich LGAs. By bridging operational gaps and improving visibility across the mining landscape, we are helping unlock Nigeria's vast untapped mineral wealth while promoting regulatory compliance and environmental stewardship.

smallprjct.title: Industrial Infrastructure
smallprjct.desc1: SEAP's industrial infrastructure program aligns clean energy investments with Nigeria's emerging industrial corridors, ports, and logistics networks. By mapping electricity demand against trade hubs, rail lines, and special economic zones, we deliver hybrid power systems where they're most needed to drive job creation, manufacturing, and export growth.

smallprjct.title: Utility-Scale Solar
smallprjct.desc1: Leveraging SEAP's GIS platform and satellite datasets (e.g., Global Solar Atlas), we identify optimal sites for utility-scale solar across Nigeria. Criteria include terrain suitability, land use, proximity to grid infrastructure, and irradiation levels—all essential for high-yield solar power plants.

FAQs.question: What is SEAP and what does it aim to achieve?
FAQs.answer: SEAP (Sustainable Energy Access Projects) is a nationwide initiative delivering clean, reliable, and affordable energy solutions—including hybrid solar-gas power, clean cooking, e-mobility infrastructure, and digital access—to all 774 Local Government Areas in Nigeria. The goal is to reduce energy poverty, drive local economic growth, and support Nigeria's transition to a low-carbon future.

FAQs.question: Where is SEAP currently operating?
FAQs.answer: SEAP will begin pilot operations in Kano, Imo, and Cross River states in Q3-Q4 2025. These pilots will guide the full-scale rollout to the remaining LGAs nationwide.

FAQs.question: How does SEAP's hybrid power system work?
FAQs.answer: The hybrid system combines solar photovoltaic arrays with gas-powered generators to ensure continuous power supply, even when sunlight is unavailable. It's designed for reliability, affordability, and scalability—particularly in underserved and off-grid communities.

FAQs.question: How can I access SEAP's data and reports?
FAQs.answer: Key reports, maps, and dashboards will be accessible via the website's Resources or Data Portal section. Commercial data sets like GIS overlays, demand models, and infrastructure maps can be licensed through our Enterprise Data Offering.

FAQs.question: What financial returns can investors expect?
FAQs.answer: Depending on the asset class and risk level, typical projected IRRs range from 12% to 25%. Clean cooking and e-mobility hubs offer quick payback (1-3 years), while hybrid power mini-grids and utility-scale solar provide steady, longer-term returns (up to 20 years) backed by demand aggregation and blended tariff structures.
